application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Seattle, WA, USA
description:
Google Cloud teams work with companies, government agencies and academic institutions to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google Cloud products to get their work done. The Google Cloud Training team is a growing organization within Google Cloud, seeking a passionate individual to develop a creative and engaging learning experience to help our customers succeed with the Google Cloud Platform products.

As a Program Manager, you'll be be responsible for tracking all curriculum development projects, including online/e-learning, instructor-led or hands-on labs content. You will plan project resources, manage timelines and report on all projects, providing insights into resource usage, timelines and budgets. You'll have technical training project/program experience, experience working cross-functionally, and excellent influencing and communication skills. You'll ensure that processes are documented and adhered to in order to support consistency and efficiencies across projects. You also have experience working with global vendors.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in technical training content development, technical curriculum development, or technical training.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PMP or Scrum Master certification.
  • 5 years of people management experience.
  • Experience in strategic planning, risk management and/or change management.
  • Knowledge of the cloud technology space and willingness to learn Google Cloud products and technologies.
  • Proficiency in G Suite (e.g., Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail, Calendar).
  • Ability to self-start, navigate ambiguity, and make recommendations for process improvements and efficiencies. Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships.
responsibilities:
• Identify resources required for each project depending on the delivery format.
  • Track projects and provide various levels of updates to stakeholders.
  • Document processes for efficient curriculum development and ensure that processes are being followed.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with global vendors, create agreements, and follow through with invoicing processes and budgets.
  • Liaise with Technical Leads, Technical Curriculum Developers and other stakeholders involved in the curriculum development process.
title: Program Manager, Training Curriculum, Google Cloud
